revised_title: Alfred North Whitehead's Contributions to Mathematics and Logic
tldr: This obituary celebrates the life and work of Alfred North Whitehead, a mathematician and philosopher who made significant contributions to the fields of logic, universal algebra, and non-Euclidean geometry. Whitehead, along with Bertrand Russell, developed the groundbreaking work Principia Mathematica, which aimed to prove that mathematics is a part of logic. His work has had a profound impact on the growth of logic and the understanding of the foundations of mathematics.
